Here is the final paragraph:

"Prehistory refers to the time before people started recording history, or writing things down. This period covers everything from the dawn of humans until the invention of writing. It's a vast stretch of time, spanning thousands of years. During prehistory, humans lived as hunters and gatherers, relying on nature for food and shelter. They didn't have technology like we do today, so they used simple tools and lived in small groups called tribes. Prehistory ended around 3000 BCE when people in different parts of the world began writing things down."

Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level: 5.1
